author: cmpilato
msg: On the issue-3220-dev branch, fix a segfault scenario.
* subversion/libsvn_repos/log.c
(fs_mergeinfo_changed): Initialize some variables.
By the way, initial results from the work done so far indicate that
this new approach is, in fact, far more accurate than the old code.
And a recent performance comparison showed this code taking 12 seconds
to do what the old code did (incorrectly, even) in nearly 6 minutes.

author: cmpilato
msg: On the issue-3220-dev branch, commit outstanding work done so far.
Prior to this change, the method used by 'log -g' for determining what
merges were made in a revision was:
- fetch all the mergeinfo found in REV
- fetch all the mergeinfo found in REV-1
- compare, contrast, and collapse the results
The problems with this approach are two-fold.  First, it's slow, and
it gets slower as more paths in a revision grow mergeinfo.  Secondly,
it's just wrong.  Just because mergeinfo appears or disappears doesn't
mean a merge was done -- perhaps a path that held some mergeinfo was
merely deleted.
The new approach is to look at only the paths changed in REV, and see
if/how their mergeinfo changed.  This is much, much faster on average
for repository actually using mergeinfo, and much more accurate as
well.
As of this commit, this basic overhaul is mostly finished.  The code
does not yet handle the effects of inherited mergeinfo on the paths of
interest, though.
* subversion/libsvn_repos/log.c
(fs_mergeinfo_changed): New (pretty-generic) mergeinfo change
calculation function.
(get_combined_mergeinfo_changes): New, supercedes ...
(get_combined_mergeinfo, get_merged_rev_mergeinfo): ...these, which
are now removed.
(do_logs): Use get_combined_mergeinfo_changes() instead of
get_merged_rev_mergeinfo().
* subversion/libsvn_repos/repos.h
(svn_repos__prev_location): New prototype.
* subversion/libsvn_repos/rev_hunt.c
(svn_repos__prev_location): Was prev_location(), now module-public.
Allow prev_rev, prev_path, and appeared_rev parameters to be NULL,
in which case (for each) don't try to set their pointer values.
Callers updated.
